title: How to Make Beigli (Hungarian Poppy Seed & Walnut Rolls)

steps.headline: Dissolve the yeast and granulated sugar in 1/4 cup of  lukewarm milk.
steps.description: Set aside for 10 minutes until the liquid forms a foamy mixture.

steps.headline: Combine the flour, icing sugar, and salt in a large bowl.
steps.description: Cut in the butter. Mix well.

steps.headline: Make a well in the center and add the yeast mixture and egg yolks.
steps.description: Mix gently, gradually adding 1/4 to 1/2 cup milk until the dough can be formed into a ball. Cover with a cloth and let rise until doubled in size (2 hours).

steps.headline: Grind the walnuts and poppy seeds separately.
Mix the ingredients for the two fillings separately in a medium saucepan and simmer over a low heat for 15 minutes, stirring frequently.
steps.description: Remove from the stove and allow to cool.

steps.headline: Divide the dough into two halves and roll each half on a floured surface into 12x18 inch rectangles.
steps.description: Spread the nut filling on one rectangle and the poppy seed filling on the other, leaving a margin of at least an inch on all edges.

steps.headline: Turn up the sides to prevent leaking and roll the beigli lengthwise to form two 12-inch rolls.
steps.description: Brush the tops of the rolls with egg whites, poke a few holes in them with a fork.

steps.headline: Bake at 350 °F (177 °C) for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown.

text: Dissolve the yeast and granulated sugar in 1/4 cup of  lukewarm milk. Set aside for 10 minutes until the liquid forms a foamy mixture. Combine the flour, icing sugar, and salt in a large bowl. Cut in the butter. Mix well. Make a well in the center and add the yeast mixture and egg yolks. Mix gently, gradually adding 1/4 to 1/2 cup milk until the dough can be formed into a ball. Cover with a cloth and let rise until doubled in size (2 hours). Grind the walnuts and poppy seeds separately.  Mix the ingredients for the two fillings separately in a medium saucepan and simmer over a low heat for 15 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove from the stove and allow to cool. Divide the dough into two halves and roll each half on a floured surface into 12x18 inch rectangles. Spread the nut filling on one rectangle and the poppy seed filling on the other, leaving a margin of at least an inch on all edges. Turn up the sides to prevent leaking and roll the beigli lengthwise to form two 12-inch rolls. Brush the tops of the rolls with egg whites, poke a few holes in them with a fork. Bake at 350 °F (177 °C) for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown.  Finished.
